{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2969276,"name":"Alex Chadwick","username":"Marsient","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-25T15:12:33.342Z","cooked":"

I’ve been working on making code for a servo. I don’t have any errors in my code, but whenever I deploy it to the robot driverstation says there’s no robot code. I’ve narrowed it down to being a problem in the subsystem because when I comment out the code that actually references the servo, it works fine and driverstation says there is code.

The is the servo subsystem code that I’ve been working on:

package frc.robot.subsystems;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Servo;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase;
import frc.robot.Constants;

public class ServoSubsystem extends SubsystemBase {

private Servo shooterServo;

public ServoSubsystem() {

 Servo shooterServo = new Servo(Constants.SERVO);

}

public void ExtendServo() {

  shooterServo.set(Constants.SERVO_EXTEND);
System.out.println("servo subsystem");

}

public void StopServo() {

  shooterServo.set(Constants.SERVO_STOP);

}

@Override
public void periodic() {
// This method will be called once per scheduler run
}
}

You should be getting lots of error text in the Driver Station console. The magic word is Exception. Would you check for errors like that and paste the text here?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2021-09-25T15:22:16.727Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":51.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":396168,"topic_slug":"no-robot-code-with-servo","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/no-robot-code-with-servo/396168/2","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969281,"name":"Alex Chadwick","username":"Marsient","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-25T15:32:42.890Z","cooked":"

Here’s the stuff that the console shows

  • ********** Robot program starting **********

  • Unhandled exception: edu.wpi.first.hal.util.UncleanStatusException: Code: -1029. HAL: Resource already allocated

  • Error at frc.robot.subsystems.ServoSubsystem.(ServoSubsystem.java:17): Unhandled exception: edu.wpi.first.hal.util.UncleanStatusException: Code: -1029. HAL: Resource already allocated

  • at edu.wpi.first.hal.PWMJNI.initializePWMPort(Native Method)

  • Robots should not quit, but yours did!

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PWM.(PWM.java:51)

  • The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Servo.(Servo.java:35)

  • at frc.robot.subsystems.ServoSubsystem.(ServoSubsystem.java:17)

  • at frc.robot.RobotContainer.(RobotContainer.java:43)

  • at frc.robot.Robot.robotInit(Robot.java:42)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot.startCompetition(TimedRobot.java:94)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:335)

  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.startRobot(RobotBase.java:407)

  • at frc.robot.Main.main(Main.java:23)

  • Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:350): Robots should not quit, but yours did!

  • Error at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:352): The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above.

Perfect. That tells me enough to say that something else is being told to use the same PWM port as your servo. Do you have other servos/PWM controllers in your code?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2021-09-25T15:34:34.831Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":70.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":396168,"topic_slug":"no-robot-code-with-servo","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48523,"username":"Marsient","name":"Alex Chadwick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/no-robot-code-with-servo/396168/4","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969288,"name":"Alex Chadwick","username":"Marsient","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-25T16:07:52.803Z","cooked":"

It turns out that there were two things both set to port 6. Whenever I look at driverstation it shows that there is robot code. When I press the button (x) that I set the servo command to, it shows that there’s no robot code for a second, disables the robot, then the robot code shows up again. When I comment out anything referencing the servo, it works when I press the button.

Is this issue still happening after changing one or both away from port 6? If so look for error text again in the console.

I was able to get it working, except that the servo only moved once. It moved when I first tested the code, but now it won’t work even though I didn’t change the code at all. I know it works because I put a few System.out.println in the servo subsystem, servo command, and where the stop command is. It shows the messages on the console, but it doesn’t actually move the servo.

What are the values for Constants.SERVO_EXTEND and Constants.SERVO_STOP?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2021-09-25T18:35:02.659Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":91.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":396168,"topic_slug":"no-robot-code-with-servo","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48523,"username":"Marsient","name":"Alex Chadwick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/no-robot-code-with-servo/396168/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969312,"name":"Alex Chadwick","username":"Marsient","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-25T18:36:21.445Z","cooked":"

SERVO_EXTEND is set to 0 (sorry the name is a bit misleading) and SERVO_STOP is set to 0.5

I’m beginning to suspect that it’s more of a wiring problem or a misconception of what the servo should be doing. Would you please explain a bit about what you expect the servo to do when it “works”?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2021-09-25T19:19:12.432Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":396168,"topic_slug":"no-robot-code-with-servo","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/no-robot-code-with-servo/396168/10","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969337,"name":"Alex Chadwick","username":"Marsient","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-25T21:26:28.807Z","cooked":"

Oh yeah, sorry for not doing that already. It’s a servo that extends and retracts. We have it blocking the intake of our shooter when it’s extended, and we’re trying to make it retract when we press the button. We’re doing this so our shooter motors can get to full speed before the ball actually gets shot out.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2021-09-25T21:26:39.165Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":19.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":396168,"topic_slug":"no-robot-code-with-servo","display_username":"Alex Chadwick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":33946,"username":"Amicus1","name":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48523,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/no-robot-code-with-servo/396168/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969338,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-09-25T21:45:19.738Z","cooked":"

How are you commanding the extend and retract methods? My guess is they’re conflicting.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":52,"updated_at":"2021-09-25T21:45:19.738Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":70,"readers_count":69,"score":24.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":396168,"topic_slug":"no-robot-code-with-servo","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/no-robot-code-with-servo/396168/12","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2969340,"name":"Alex Chadwick","username":"Marsient","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marsient/{size}/154894_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-25T22:02:04.175Z","cooked":"

Here’s the servo command, I’m not sure if I should make a second command, since I want it to return to a set position after I’ve let go of the button (it’s active while held).

package frc.robot.commands;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase;
import frc.robot.subsystems.ServoSubsystem;

public class ServoExtendCommand extends CommandBase {
/** Creates a new ServoExtendCommand. */

private final ServoSubsystem servoSubsystem;

public ServoExtendCommand(ServoSubsystem subsystem) {
servoSubsystem = subsystem;

addRequirements(servoSubsystem);
// Use addRequirements() here to declare subsystem dependencies.

}

// Called when the command is initially scheduled.
@Override
public void initialize() {

}

// Called every time the scheduler runs while the command is scheduled.
@Override
public void execute() {
servoSubsystem.RetractServo();
System.out.println(“servo command”);
}

// Called once the command ends or is interrupted.
@Override
public void end(boolean interrupted) {
servoSubsystem.ExtendServo();

System.out.println("servo end");

}

// Returns true when the command should end.
@Override
public boolean isFinished() {
return false;
}
}

Marsient:

private Servo shooterServo;

public ServoSubsystem() {

 Servo shooterServo = new Servo(Constants.SERVO);

}

I think the problem is that private Servo shooterServo in the ServoSubsystem is never initialized. In the constructor, you are declaring a new servo object instead of assigning the pre-declared servo object. If you remove the first Servo from Servo shooterServo = new Servo(Constants.SERVO);, that will assign it instead of declaring it again, so you just need shooterServo = new Servo(Constants.SERVO); in the constructor.
